pullrequest.title: Task 1: Update satellite colors and wheel directions

content.raw: I like it!!! Can't wait to see all these colors in a world.
content.html: I like it!!! Can't wait to see all these colors in a world.

pullrequest.title: Task 1: Update satellite colors and wheel directions

content.raw:
I tried this out locally, and the colors seem better to me.

It looks like this PR also moves around the rocks and crates in the world as well.  Is that intended?  I'm going to approve this PR since it is fine for me either way, I just thought I would point out that this is more than just the colors and wheel directions.
content.html:
I tried this out locally, and the colors seem better to me.

It looks like this PR also moves around the rocks and crates in the world as well. Is that intended? I'm going to approve this PR since it is fine for me either way, I just thought I would point out that this is more than just the colors and wheel directions.

pullrequest.title: Task 1: Update satellite colors and wheel directions

content.raw: Thanks for the review and for paying attention to all the aspects. The reason why everything changed is that I had to generate a new world to get the satellite changes in. Sure, I suppose I could have copy/pasted just the satellite into the old world... But in any case, the worlds have changed since the previous release due to other logical changes, so I'm not sure there's much value in manually editing it now...
content.html: Thanks for the review and for paying attention to all the aspects. The reason why everything changed is that I had to generate a new world to get the satellite changes in. Sure, I suppose I could have copy/pasted just the satellite into the old world... But in any case, the worlds have changed since the previous release due to other logical changes, so I'm not sure there's much value in manually editing it now...

pullrequest.title: Task 1: Update satellite colors and wheel directions

content.raw: Oh, now I see.  That's why we keep having conflicts in unique.world; every time you regenerate, you get a new world, plus whatever changes you are working on.  OK, I finally get it :).  That's totally fine, then.
content.html: Oh, now I see. That's why we keep having conflicts in unique.world; every time you regenerate, you get a new world, plus whatever changes you are working on. OK, I finally get it :). That's totally fine, then.
